clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of the Treatment for Infant Iron Deficiency Anemia by Taking Lactoferrin and Ferralia
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of the Treatment for Infant Iron Deficiency Anemia by Taking Lactoferrin and Ferralia

lead_sponsor.agency: Beingmate Baby & Child Food Co Ltd .

clinical_study.source: Beingmate Baby & Child Food Co Ltd .

brief_summary.textblock: A multi-center,randomized,double-blind,controlled clinical trial was used to investigate the effectiveness of the treatment of infant iron deficiency anemia by taking ferralia and different contents lactoferrin.

detailed_description.textblock: 5-9 months old infants with iron deficiency anemia were randomly divided into three groups. On the basis of giving the same dose of ferralia,three different levels lactoferrin infant formula were intervened 3 months respectively,and evaluate the clinical effect.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of Hb concentration from baseline at 1 month and 3 months.
primary_outcome.description: Hb was measured by the hemoglobincyanide method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes of body weight from baseline at 1 month and 3 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight is detected by electronic scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes of body weight from baseline at 1 month and 3 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Body length is detected by infant height bed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes of body weight from baseline at 1 month and 3 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Head circumference detected by measuring tape

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes of serum iron concentration from baseline at 3 months.
secondary_outcome.description: concentrations of serum ferritin (SF,μg/L) were measured using a commercial enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA; Sunbiote, Shanghai, China).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of serum transferrin receptor concentration(mg/L)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes of serum transferrin receptor concentration from baseline at 3 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Serum soluble transferrin receptor (sTfR, mg/L) was measured by microparticle-enhanced immunoassay (Sunbiote, Shanghai, China)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Full term,healthy infants at 37-42 weeks of gestational age
- 5-9 months old infants were diagnose as iron deficiency anemia
- Accepting bottle feeding
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hb<60 g/L
- Other microcytic, hypochromic anemia
